newsitem.title: UK: UK truckers protest at slow French compensation.
newsitem.headline: UK truckers protest at slow French compensation.

text.p: France has failed to keep promises to compensate British trucks caught up in the French hauliers dispute last November, the British Freight Transport Association (FTA) and Road Haulage Associations (RTA) said.
At one stage during the 12 day blockade November over 1,000 British trucks were trapped at ports and on roads.

Recent French statements and the introduction of further hurdles and complications to the claims process has cast doubt on France's intention to honour the promise made to the British government at the time of and since the French disputes, a joint statement by the trade bodies stated.

The British Transport Department has written to all those seeking compensation saying France is now demanding further information, some of which must be supplied in French and not English as originally agreed.
The original agreement allowed claims from those unable to enter France because of the blockades but this has now been withdrawn altogether.

Claims were made from the beginning of January with settlement expected in May, but so far none have been paid, the trade bodies said. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017 - www.racs.com
